apiClassifier.shortdesc: Enumeration defining field acces types.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Enumeration defining field acces types. A class field can be accessed in readonly, writeonly or readwrite modes.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines a constructor argument.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Defines a constructor argument. This annotaton is used when a class has a non default constructor. In order to maintain the business restrictions, FlexXB will determine the values of the arguments based on the received xml and call the constructor with those values.
An argument has a reference; the reference is the name of the class field whose value it represents. A non default constructor will most often configure some of the object's fields when called. Since the only available data is the incoming xml, arguments must specify the field the the constructor will modify with the received value.
The class field referenced in the argument must have an annotation defined for it

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines a metadata decorating a class field or class.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This interface defines a metadata decorating a class field or class. It exposes a name and a type as any class field has a name and a type.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the contract interface for a class annotation.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This is the contract interface for a class annotation. A class annotation holds all the annotation structure relevant for that type, being the FlexXB's representation of the type. This representation is used in the (de)serialization process so the engine will know how to generate and parse xml.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This contract specifies the basic requirements for a FlexXB recognized annotation.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This contract specifies the basic requirements for a FlexXB recognized annotation. The basic annotation must provide a name and a version. Annotations of specific versions will be grouped together.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Commonly used constants.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Commonly used constants.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the base class for all annotations.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This is the base class for all annotations. It implements the most basic contract, IAnnotation, and offers the means of retrieving the metadata attributes and their values from the type descriptor. This information is passed inthe constructor via a MetaDescriptor object and one must override the protected methd parse in order to apply the necesary attributes on their own annotations. This mechanism makes the annotations to not require direct access to the xml descriptor of the type being introspected.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This contact interface defines the structure of a member annotation, that is, an annotation that is used only on class fields.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This contact interface defines the structure of a member annotation, that is, an annotation that is used only on class fields. A basic member annotation has a reference to its parent class annotation, has an access type (read, write, read/write) and can be ignored in one of the two stages of the engine's processing: serialization or deserialization.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines the class constructor.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Defines the class constructor. Notifies the owner XmlClass whether the described type has a default constructor or not.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This enumeration defines the preocessing directions supported by the FlexXBEngine: serialize and deserialize
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This enumeration defines the preocessing directions supported by the FlexXBEngine: serialize and deserialize

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface describes a metadata defined at class level, that is bound to the class owner metadata but defines particularities specific to the class itself.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This interface describes a metadata defined at class level, that is bound to the class owner metadata but defines particularities specific to the class itself. Good examples to this end are constructor arguments metadata or namespaces used by the class fields. They are not bound to a field name and type but they afect the class representation. This kind of annotations does not usually need a serializer.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines the api structure and access points
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This interface defines the api structure and access points

apiClassifier.shortdesc: API member annotation wrapper.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: API member annotation wrapper. This is the base for member annotation API description. It references the field from the parent type and base attributes that all members will share: version and ignore flags. All member annotations have a version in order to handle different representations of the same object that may appear as appplication develoment evolves. Also, some fields may be ignored in different stages of the processing: serialize or deserialize.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Wrapper holding the class descriptors specified in the xml api descriptor file
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Wrapper holding the class descriptors specified in the xml api descriptor file

apiClassifier.shortdesc: A constructor argument is a way to say to the FlexXB engine that objects of a certain type need a special way to be instantiated in the deserialization stage.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: A constructor argument is a way to say to the FlexXB engine that objects of a certain type need a special way to be instantiated in the deserialization stage. A constructor argument is linked to a class field. Usually, when having parameterized arguments, in the constructor these values are mapped to specific fields within the object.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: API wrapper for a class type.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: API wrapper for a class type. Allows programatically defining all the elements that would normally be specified via annotations.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines a cache provider recognised by FlexXB engine.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This interface defines a cache provider recognised by FlexXB engine.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the interface for objects used by the object cache.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This is the interface for objects used by the object cache. Using this interface will give the implementor objects the ability to get their cleanup method called when they are returned to the cache. The object Cache can store any type of objects, regardless whether they implement IPooledObject or not.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the cache for object instances.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
This is the cache for object instances. It maintains a pool for each object type. It works a bit differently... objects in pool are used then released to be used by others. While an object is in use it cannot be reasigned to other. Once the user is done with the instance, it must call releaseInstance method.
ObjectPool does not use an id. Objects are assigned baed on the used state. If all available objects are in use then a new instance will be created. If there is an object released, it will be passed on for use. That's why sometimes it is required to clean the objects after use. This is where the IPooledObject interface comes to use by exposing the clear method which should be implemented by the objects that require some cleanup before being reused.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Date converter conforming to the W3C standard
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Date converter conforming to the W3C standard

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Converter for XML objects
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Converter for XML objects

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Interface defining how strings can be converted to specific objects and viceversa.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Interface defining how strings can be converted to specific objects and viceversa.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Converter for Class objects
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Converter for Class objects

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface is used to determine the version of an incoming document.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This interface is used to determine the version of an incoming document. The version is considerent consistent throughout the entire document and as such the engine will extract it once per received document.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Description context is the main access point for instructing the engine how to handle a specific serialization format.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Description context is the main access point for instructing the engine how to handle a specific serialization format. The context registers annotations, serializers, converters and offers additional methods to assist the registered serializers with the handling of that serialization format. A context also has an instance of a configuration object; as is the case with different formats, additional settings are needed for configuring the mechanism. One may extend the default configuration object to add settings as needed and reference them in the serializers.
This class must be extended if one is to provide a new serialization format support. In subclasses the method performInitialization must be overriden in order to register serializers, annotations and converters.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Entry point for AS3-? (de)serialization.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Entry point for AS3-? (de)serialization. Allows new annotation registration. The main access point consist of two methods: serialize() and deserialize, each corresponding to the specific stage in the conversion process. By default it registeres the built-in xml handling annotations through the xml description context.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This class defines the settings the FlexXB Core and serialization contexts accept in order to control processing.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This class defines the settings the FlexXB Core and serialization contexts accept in order to control processing. You may override this class to add more settings that will be used in your serialization contexts and serializers.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This interface defines a core that handles a specific way of serializing/deserializing and object.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This interface defines a core that handles a specific way of serializing/deserializing and object. It makes use of a serialization context to inject all the particularities of a specific serialization format. Also, within the context serializers and converters are registered.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Triggers after the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Triggers after the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Triggers prior to the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Triggers prior to the deserialization of a data source into an AS3 object

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Triggers after the serialization of an AS3 object

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Triggers after the serialization of an AS3 object

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Triggers prior to the serialization of an object

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Triggers prior to the serialization of an object

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Event being raised by the serialization mechanism in order to signal various stages teh process is in.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Event being raised by the serialization mechanism in order to signal various stages teh process is in. The event is raised for each complex object/subobject being processed. There are four types of events one should listen for to hook into the mechanism:
preserialize - raised before the serialization of an object begins
postserialize - raised after the objet's serialization ends
predeserialize - raised before the deserialization of data to an object begins
postdeserialize - raised after the deserialization ends

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems parsing the type descriptor xml
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems parsing the type descriptor xml

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems processing the xml, be it in the serialize or the deserialize stages.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Error thrown when the FlexXB engine encounters problems processing the xml, be it in the serialize or the deserialize stages.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This error is thrown when the FlexXB API engine encounters execution problems.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This error is thrown when the FlexXB API engine encounters execution problems.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Provides a method to uniquely identify objects of a certain type.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Provides a method to uniquely identify objects of a certain type.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the deserialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post deserialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the deserialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post deserialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step. Implementing this interface overrides the normal event dispatching in the engine.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Optional interface that can be implemented by FlexXB bound objects to handle cycles in the object graph.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Optional interface that can be implemented by FlexXB bound objects to handle cycles in the object graph.
Normally a cycle in the object graph causes the engine to throw an error. This is not always a desired behavior.Implementing this interface allows the user application to change this behavior.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the serialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post serialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Optional interface to be implemented by objects which need specific notification on the serialization process. If the current object to be serialized implements this interface, the engine will call the methods implemented on each process step (pre and post serialize) instead of firing a SerializationEvent on the engine instance for each step. Implementing this interface overrides the normal event dispatching in the engine.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Interface for an object that requires custom serialization/deserialization into/from a serialization format (XML, JSON, AMF etc.).
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Interface for an object that requires custom serialization/deserialization into/from a serialization format (XML, JSON, AMF etc.). Use this interface to instruct the engine to delegate the serialization/deserialization task to the object itself.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Main implementation of IPersistable.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Main implementation of IPersistable. A persistable object is capable of tracking changes done to it and reverting to initial values if required. It should be base for all model objects that need initial state memory capabilities such as IPersistable allows. It uses the methods commit() and rollback() to save the current state or to revert to the previously saved state.
Basically, this object listens for changes to all its public properties and variables and saves the initial value set for that field. Upon commit, the list of initial values is discarded, the new values thus becoming initial values. On rollback, the initial values are reinstated the object returning to the state before eny change had been made.
Note: Subclasses should be decorated with the [Bindable] annotation so all changes to the public fields would be registered.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Interface defining an object that can be persisted.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Interface defining an object that can be persisted. A persistable object is capable of tracking changes done to it and reverting to initial values if required. IPersistable exposes three methods:
modified - check if object has been changed since its last save
commit - make changes done from the last save persistent
rollback - revert to the initial state of the object

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Adds to ArrayCollection the functionalities specified by IPersistable.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Adds to ArrayCollection the functionalities specified by IPersistable. Should be used in model objects the require having lists of referenced objects.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Communicates with the server by sending xml requests and receiving xml responses
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Communicates with the server by sending xml requests and receiving xml responses

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Base Service for communicating with the server.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Base Service for communicating with the server. All data service classes should extend this class

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Communication interface
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Communication interface

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Entry point for AS3-XML (de)serialization.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Entry point for AS3-XML (de)serialization. Allows new annotation registration. The main access point consist of two methods: serialize() and deserialize, each corresponding to the specific stage in the conversion process.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Defines a member of an XmlClass, that is, a field of the class definition.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
Defines a member of an XmlClass, that is, a field of the class definition. The XmlMember is base for XmlAttribute and XmlElement since field values can be rendered as XML in the form of attributes or elements.
A member's alias can define "virtual paths". Virtual paths allow definition of complex xml structures for a field without complicating the model design. Thus, structures can be present in the xml just by adding vistual paths in the alias definition of a member.
Example: Lets assume the xml representation looks like:
<myPathTester> <anotherSub attTest="Thu Mar 19 15:49:32 GMT+0200 2009"/> This is Default!!! <subObject> <id> 2 </id> <subSubObj> <ref> ReferenceTo </ref> </subSubObj> </subObject> </myPathTester>
This would normally translate itself in about 4 model classes. Using virtual paths, one can describe it in just one model class:
[XmlClass(alias="myPathTester", defaultValueField="defaultTest")] public class XmlPathObject { [XmlElement(alias="subObject/id")] public var identity : Number = 2; [XmlElement(alias="subObject/subSubObj/ref")] public var reference : String = "ReferenceTo"; [XmlArray(alias="subObject/list")] public var list : Array; [XmlAttribute(alias="anotherSub/attTest")] public var test : Date = new Date(); [XmlElement()] public var defaultTest : String = "This is Default!!!"
public function XmlPathObject() { } }

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This is the base class for a field xml annotation.
apiClassifier.apiDesc:
This is the base class for a field xml annotation.
It obtains basic informations about the field:
Field name
Field type
Alias (the name under which the field will be used in the xml reprezentation)

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Usage: [XmlClass(alias="MyClass", useNamespaceFrom="elementFieldName", idField="idFieldName", prefix="my", uri="http://www.your.site.com/schema/", defaultValueField="fieldName", ordered="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiDesc.p: Usage: [XmlClass(alias="MyClass", useNamespaceFrom="elementFieldName", idField="idFieldName", prefix="my", uri="http://www.your.site.com/schema/", defaultValueField="fieldName", ordered="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Usage: [XmlArray(alias="element", memberName="NameOfArrayElement", getFromCache="true|false", type="my.full.type" ignoreOn="serialize|deserialize", serializePartialElement="true|false", order="order_index", namespace="Namespace_Prefix", idref="true|false", setXsiType="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiDesc.p: Usage: [XmlArray(alias="element", memberName="NameOfArrayElement", getFromCache="true|false", type="my.full.type" ignoreOn="serialize|deserialize", serializePartialElement="true|false", order="order_index", namespace="Namespace_Prefix", idref="true|false", setXsiType="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Usage: [XmlElement(alias="element", getFromCache="true|false", ignoreOn="serialize|deserialize", serializePartialElement="true|false", order="order_index", getRuntimeType="true|false", namespace="Namespace_Prefix", default="DEFAULT_VALUE", idref="true|false", setXsiType="true|false", version="versionName")]
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Usage: [XmlElement(alias="element", getFromCache="true|false", ignoreOn="serialize|deserialize", serializePartialElement="true|false", order="order_index", getRuntimeType="true|false", namespace="Namespace_Prefix", default="DEFAULT_VALUE", idref="true|false", setXsiType="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Usage: [XmlAttribute(alias="attribute", ignoreOn="serialize|deserialize", order="order_index", namespace="NameSpace_Prefix", default="DEFAULT_VALUE", idref="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiDesc.p: Usage: [XmlAttribute(alias="attribute", ignoreOn="serialize|deserialize", order="order_index", namespace="NameSpace_Prefix", default="DEFAULT_VALUE", idref="true|false", version="versionName")]

apiClassifier.shortdesc: API wrapper for a class type.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: API wrapper for a class type. Allows programatically defining all the elements that would normally be specified via annotations.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Insures serialization/deserialization for object field decorated with the XmlArray annotation.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Insures serialization/deserialization for object field decorated with the XmlArray annotation.

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Insures serialization/deserialization for object field decorated with the XmlAttribute annotation
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Insures serialization/deserialization for object field decorated with the XmlAttribute annotation

apiClassifier.shortdesc: Insures serialization/deserialization for object field decorated with the XmlElement annotation
apiClassifier.apiDesc: Insures serialization/deserialization for object field decorated with the XmlElement annotation

apiClassifier.shortdesc: This class is used to determine the version of an incoming document.
apiClassifier.apiDesc: This class is used to determine the version of an incoming document. The version is considerent consistent throughout the entire document and as such the engine will extract it once per received document. By default, the version extractor searches for an attribute named "version". If you require another kind of processing for versions you should extend this class and override the getVersion method which returns a String and accepts the xml document as source
